metadata.Title: CVE-2011-2500 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The host_reliable_addrinfo function in support/export/hostname.c innfs-utils before 1.2.4 does not properly use DNS to verify access to NFSexports, which allows remote attackers to mount filesystems by establishingcrafted DNS A and PTR records.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2500` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nfs-common - 1:1.2.8-6ubuntu1
nfs-kernel-server - 1:1.2.8-6ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nfs-utils package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.2.8-6ubuntu1').
